etl.description: This example imports a CSV with currency exchange rates into a database. Custom formatting rules are used for parsing text values. After that data is exported into a CSV with different formatting rules.
etl.connection: #Define formatting of columns in the input CSV file format.CurrencyPair.trim=true format.RateDateTime.type=date format.RateDateTime.pattern=yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS

quote= #Define formatting of columns in the input CSV file format.Time.type=date format.Time.pattern=dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss format.Bid.type=number format.Bid.pattern=##.0000 format.Ask.type=number format.Ask.pattern=##.0000
etl.script: CREATE TABLE Rates (Time DATE PRIMARY KEY, CurrencyPair VARCHAR(10), Bid Decimal, Ask Decimal );

query.script: INSERT INTO Rates(TIME, CurrencyPair, Bid, Ask) VALUES (?RateDateTime, ?CurrencyPair, ?RateBid, ?RateAsk);

etl.query:
SELECT * FROM Rates ORDER BY Time
$Time,$CurrencyPair,$Bid, $Ask
